001package io.jstach.rainbowgum;
002
003import java.io.FileDescriptor;
004import java.io.Flushable;
005import java.io.IOException;
006import java.io.OutputStream;
007import java.io.UncheckedIOException;
008import java.net.URI;
009import java.net.URISyntaxException;
010import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
011import java.nio.channels.FileChannel;
012import java.nio.channels.FileLock;
013import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
014import java.util.Objects;
015
016import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEncoder.Buffer;
017import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogOutput.ThreadSafeLogOutput;
018import io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation.CaseChanging;
019
020/**
021 * A resource that can be written to usually in binary. In other logging frameworks this
022 * is often called an "Appender" not be confused with RainbowGum's appenders. LogOutputs
023 * will be written synchronously by the appender either through locks or some other
024 * mechanism so other than output external specific locking (e.g file locking or db
025 * transaction) the output does not have to deal with that. <strong> In other words there
026 * will be no overlapping write calls as the appender and publisher combo promises that.
027 * </strong>
028 * <p>
029 * To simplyfy flushing and corruption prevention each call to the write methods MUST be
030 * the contents of the entire event!
031 * <p>
032 * The write methods do not throw {@link IOException} on purpose as it is implementations
033 * responsibility to handle errors and to be resilient on their own.
034 *
035 * @see LogOutput.OutputProvider
036 * @see Buffer
037 * @apiNote if for some reason the output needs to share events with other threads call
038 * {@link LogEvent#freeze()} which will return an immutable event.
039 */
040public interface LogOutput extends LogLifecycle, Flushable {
041
042        /**
043         * {@link FileDescriptor#err} URI scheme.
044         */
045        static final String STDERR_SCHEME = "stderr";
046
047        /**
048         * {@link FileDescriptor#out} URI scheme.
049         */
050        static final String STDOUT_SCHEME = "stdout";
051
052        /**
053         * File URI scheme.
054         */
055        static final String FILE_SCHEME = "file";
056
057        /**
058         * Standard OUT URI.
059         */
060        static final URI STDOUT_URI = uri(STDOUT_SCHEME + ":///");
061
062        /**
063         * Standard ERR URI
064         */
065        static final URI STDERR_URI = uri(STDERR_SCHEME + ":///");
066
067        /*
068         * This is because URI create is nullable.
069         */
070        private static URI uri(String s) {
071                try {
072                        return new URI(s);
073                }
074                catch (URISyntaxException e) {
075                        throw new RuntimeException(e);
076                }
077        }
078
079        /**
080         * Provides a lazy loaded output from a URI.
081         * @param uri uri.
082         * @return provider of output.
083         * @apiNote the provider may throw an {@link UncheckedIOException}.
084         */
085        public static LogConfig.Provider<LogOutput> of(URI uri) {
086                return (s, c) -> {
087                        try {
088                                return c.outputRegistry().provide(uri, s, c.properties());
089                        }
090                        catch (IOException e) {
091                                throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
092                        }
093                };
094        }
095
096        /**
097         * Standard out output. The default implementation <em>uses whatever is set to
098         * {@link System#out} at provision time</em>. <strong>If {@link System#out} is rebound
099         * the output will not be updated!</strong>
100         * @return output.
101         */
102        public static LogConfig.Provider<LogOutput> ofStandardOut() {
103                return of(LogOutput.STDOUT_URI);
104        }
105
106        /**
107         * Standard err output. The default implementation <em>uses whatever is set to
108         * {@link System#err} at provision time</em>. <strong>If {@link System#err} is rebound
109         * the output will not be updated!</strong>
110         * @return output.
111         */
112        public static LogConfig.Provider<LogOutput> ofStandardErr() {
113                return of(LogOutput.STDERR_URI);
114        }
115
116        /**
117         * Finds output based on URI.
118         */
119        public interface OutputProvider extends PluginProvider<LogOutput, IOException> {
120
121                /**
122                 * Loads an output from a URI.
123                 * @param uri uri.
124                 * @param name name of output.
125                 * @param properties key value config.
126                 * @return output.
127                 * @throws IOException if unable to use the URI.
128                 */
129                @Override
130                LogOutput provide(URI uri, String name, LogProperties properties) throws IOException;
131
132        }
133
134        /**
135         * The content type of the binary data passed to the output from an encoder.
136         */
137        public interface ContentType {
138
139                /**
140                 * Content type of binary datay passed to output.
141                 * @return content type.
142                 */
143                String contentType();
144
145                /**
146                 * Builtin content types.
147                 */
148                @CaseChanging
149                public enum StandardContentType implements ContentType {
150
151                        /**
152                         * text/plain
153                         */
154                        TEXT_PLAIN() {
155                                @Override
156                                public String contentType() {
157                                        return "text/plain";
158                                }
159                        },
160                        /**
161                         * application/json
162                         */
163                        APPLICATION_JSON() {
164                                @Override
165                                public String contentType() {
166                                        return "application/json";
167                                }
168                        }
169
170                }
171
172        }
173
174        /**
175         * The uri of the output.
176         * @return uri.
177         * @throws UnsupportedOperationException if this output does not support URI
178         * representation.
179         *
180         */
181        public URI uri() throws UnsupportedOperationException;
182
183        @Override
184        default void start(LogConfig config) {
185        }
186
187        /**
188         * Write a batch of events by default calls
189         * {@link #write(LogEvent[], int, LogEncoder, Buffer)}. <strong>DO NOT MODIFY THE
190         * ARRAY</strong>. Do not use the <code>length</code> of the passed in array but
191         * instead use <code>count</code> parameter.
192         * @param events an array guaranteed to be smaller than count.
193         * @param count the number of items.
194         * @param encoder encoder to use for encoding.
195         */
196        default void write(LogEvent[] events, int count, LogEncoder encoder) {
197                try (var buffer = encoder.buffer()) {
198                        write(events, count, encoder, buffer);
199                }
200        }
201
202        /**
203         * Write a batch of events reusing the provided buffer and by default calling
204         * {@link #write(LogEvent, Buffer)} for each event synchronously.
205         * <p>
206         * The batching is usually a result of an asynchronous publisher so the maximum size
207         * is configured there with bufferSize. If this method is implemented there are some
208         * caveats.
209         * <p>
210         * <strong>DO NOT MODIFY THE ARRAY</strong>. It is reused. Do not use the
211         * <code>length</code> of the passed in array but instead use <code>count</code>
212         * parameter. Consequently do not share the array or buffer with other threads however
213         * individual events can be shared by calling {@link LogEvent#freeze()} to guarantee
214         * that which is a safe no-op if it is already immutable.
215         * <p>
216         * If the output plans on grouping the events into a single blob (byte array or byte
217         * buffer) a different output can be passed to the encoder other than itself (which is
218         * the default).
219         * @param events an array guaranteed to be smaller than count.
220         * @param count the number of items.
221         * @param encoder encoder to use for encoding.
222         * @param buffer buffer to reuse. Do not share it with other threads!
223         * @apiNote If the output wants to fan-out or encode with other threads the buffer
224         * passed should not be used and instead {@link LogEncoder#buffer()} should be called
225         * to get a new buffer for each thread. This is generally not desirable for most
226         * resources such as a file or database as sending a batch is much faster (single
227         * writer principle).
228         */
229        default void write(LogEvent[] events, int count, LogEncoder encoder, Buffer buffer) {
230                for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
231                        buffer.clear();
232                        var event = events[i];
233                        encoder.encode(event, buffer);
234                        write(event, buffer);
235                }
236        }
237
238        /**
239         * Writes a prepared buffer and by default drains the buffer to this output.
240         * @param event event.
241         * @param buffer buffer that is already filled. Do not share it with other threads!
242         * @apiNote the buffer already has the encoding.
243         */
244        default void write(LogEvent event, Buffer buffer) {
245                buffer.drain(this, event);
246        }
247
248        /**
249         * Writes a string and by default with charset {@link StandardCharsets#UTF_8}.
250         * @param event event associated with string.
251         * @param s string.
252         */
253        default void write(LogEvent event, String s) {
254                write(event, s.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8), ContentType.StandardContentType.TEXT_PLAIN);
255        }
256
257        /**
258         * Analogous to {@link OutputStream#write(byte[])}.
259         * @param event event associated with bytes.
260         * @param bytes data to be written.
261         * @param contentType content type of the bytes.
262         */
263        default void write(LogEvent event, byte[] bytes, ContentType contentType) {
264                write(event, bytes, 0, bytes.length, contentType);
265        }
266
267        /**
268         * Analogous to {@link OutputStream#write(byte[], int, int)}.
269         * @param event event associated with bytes.
270         * @param bytes data to be written.
271         * @param off offset.
272         * @param len length.
273         * @param contentType content type of the bytes.
274         */
275        public void write(LogEvent event, byte[] bytes, int off, int len, ContentType contentType);
276
277        /**
278         * Write event with byte buffer.
279         * @param event event.
280         * @param buf byte buffer.
281         * @param contentType content type of the buf
282         */
283        default void write(LogEvent event, ByteBuffer buf, ContentType contentType) {
284                byte[] arr = new byte[buf.position()];
285                buf.rewind();
286                buf.get(arr);
287                write(event, arr, contentType);
288        }
289
290        @Override
291        public void flush();
292
293        /**
294         * Gross categorization of an output.
295         * @return output type.
296         */
297        public OutputType type();
298
299        /**
300         * The preferred write style of this output. The output should still honor all write
301         * methods but this signals to the encoder which style it prefers.
302         * @return write mode.
303         */
304        default WriteMethod writeMethod() {
305                return switch (type()) {
306                        case CONSOLE_OUT, CONSOLE_ERR -> WriteMethod.BYTES;
307                        case FILE, NETWORK -> WriteMethod.BYTE_BUFFER;
308                        case MEMORY -> WriteMethod.STRING;
309                };
310        }
311
312        /**
313         * The preferred write style of an output. The output should still honor all write
314         * methods but this signals to the encoder which style it prefers.
315         */
316        public enum WriteMethod {
317
318                /**
319                 * Prefer calling {@link LogOutput#write(LogEvent, String)}.
320                 */
321                STRING,
322                /**
323                 * Prefer calling {@link LogOutput#write(LogEvent, byte[], ContentType)} or
324                 * {@link LogOutput#write(LogEvent, byte[], int, int, ContentType)}.
325                 */
326                BYTES,
327                /**
328                 * Prefer calling {@link LogOutput#write(LogEvent, ByteBuffer, ContentType)}.
329                 */
330                BYTE_BUFFER
331
332        }
333
334        /**
335         * Output type useful for defaults and categorization.
336         */
337        @CaseChanging
338        public enum OutputType {
339
340                /**
341                 * Standard out.
342                 */
343                CONSOLE_OUT,
344                /**
345                 * Standard err.
346                 */
347                CONSOLE_ERR,
348                /**
349                 * Output targets a file.
350                 */
351                FILE,
352                /**
353                 * Output targets something over a network.
354                 */
355                NETWORK,
356                /**
357                 * Output targets in memory.
358                 */
359                MEMORY;
360
361        }
362
363        /**
364         * Creates an output from a file channel.
365         * @param uri uri of output.
366         * @param channel file channel.
367         * @return output.
368         */
369        public static LogOutput of(URI uri, FileChannel channel) {
370                return new FileChannelOutput(uri, channel);
371        }
372
373        @Override
374        void close();
375
376        /**
377         * Marker interface that the output is thread safe.
378         */
379        public interface ThreadSafeLogOutput extends LogOutput {
380
381        }
382
383        /**
384         * Abstract output on output stream.
385         */
386        abstract class AbstractOutputStreamOutput implements LogOutput {
387
388                /**
389                 * passed in uri
390                 */
391                protected final URI uri;
392
393                /**
394                 * output stream to write to.
395                 */
396                protected final OutputStream outputStream;
397
398                /**
399                 * Adapts an OutputStream to an Output.
400                 * @param uri usually comes from output registry.
401                 * @param outputStream output stream to adapt.
402                 */
403                protected AbstractOutputStreamOutput(URI uri, OutputStream outputStream) {
404                        super();
405                        this.uri = uri;
406                        this.outputStream = outputStream;
407                }
408
409                @Override
410                public URI uri() {
411                        return uri;
412                }
413
414                @Override
415                public void write(LogEvent event, byte[] bytes, int off, int len, ContentType contentType) {
416                        try {
417                                outputStream.write(bytes, off, len);
418                        }
419                        catch (IOException e) {
420                                throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
421                        }
422                }
423
424                @Override
425                public void flush() {
426                        try {
427                                outputStream.flush();
428                        }
429                        catch (IOException e) {
430                                throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
431                        }
432                }
433
434                @Override
435                public void close() {
436                        try {
437                                outputStream.close();
438                        }
439                        catch (IOException e) {
440                                throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
441                        }
442                }
443
444                @Override
445                public WriteMethod writeMethod() {
446                        return WriteMethod.BYTES;
447                }
448
449        }
450
451}
452
453class SynchronizedLogOutput implements ThreadSafeLogOutput {
454
455        private final LogOutput output;
456
457        public SynchronizedLogOutput(LogOutput output) {
458                this.output = output;
459        }
460
461        @Override
462        public URI uri() throws UnsupportedOperationException {
463                return output.uri();
464        }
465
466        @Override
467        public synchronized void write(LogEvent event, byte[] bytes, int off, int len, ContentType contentType) {
468                output.write(event, bytes, off, len, contentType);
469        }
470
471        @Override
472        public synchronized void flush() {
473                output.flush();
474        }
475
476        @Override
477        public synchronized void close() {
478                output.close();
479        }
480
481        @Override
482        public OutputType type() {
483                return output.type();
484        }
485
486}
487
488class FileChannelOutput implements LogOutput {
489
490        protected final URI uri;
491
492        protected final FileChannel channel;
493
494        public FileChannelOutput(URI uri, FileChannel channel) {
495                super();
496                this.uri = uri;
497                this.channel = channel;
498        }
499
500        @Override
501        public URI uri() throws UnsupportedOperationException {
502                return uri;
503        }
504
505        @Override
506        public void write(LogEvent event, byte[] bytes, int off, int len, ContentType contentType) {
507                write(event, ByteBuffer.wrap(bytes, off, len), contentType);
508        }
509
510        @Override
511        public void write(LogEvent event, ByteBuffer buffer, ContentType contentType) {
512                try {
513
514                        // Clear any current interrupt (see LOGBACK-875)
515                        boolean interrupted = Thread.interrupted();
516
517                        FileLock fileLock = null;
518                        try {
519                                fileLock = channel.lock();
520                                long position = channel.position();
521                                long size = channel.size();
522                                if (size != position) {
523                                        channel.position(size);
524                                }
525                                channel.write(buffer);
526
527                        }
528                        catch (IOException e) {
529                                MetaLog.error(FileChannelOutput.class, e);
530                        }
531                        finally {
532                                if (fileLock != null && fileLock.isValid()) {
533                                        fileLock.release();
534                                }
535                                if (interrupted) {
536                                        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
537                                }
538                        }
539                }
540                catch (IOException e) {
541                        throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
542                }
543        }
544
545        @Override
546        public void close() {
547                try {
548                        channel.close();
549                }
550                catch (IOException e) {
551                        throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
552                }
553        }
554
555        @Override
556        public void flush() {
557                try {
558                        channel.force(false);
559                }
560                catch (IOException e) {
561                        throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
562                }
563        }
564
565        @Override
566        public OutputType type() {
567                return OutputType.FILE;
568        }
569
570}
571
572class StdOutOutput extends LogOutput.AbstractOutputStreamOutput {
573
574        public StdOutOutput() {
575                super(LogOutput.STDOUT_URI, Objects.requireNonNull(System.out));
576        }
577
578        @Override
579        public LogOutput.OutputType type() {
580                return OutputType.CONSOLE_OUT;
581        }
582
583        @Override
584        public void close() {
585        }
586
587}
588
589class StdErrOutput extends LogOutput.AbstractOutputStreamOutput {
590
591        protected StdErrOutput() {
592                super(LogOutput.STDERR_URI, Objects.requireNonNull(System.err));
593        }
594
595        @Override
596        public OutputType type() {
597                return OutputType.CONSOLE_ERR;
598        }
599
600}
